column4: hey guys.. i'm having trouble with my network.. on my windows machine its asking me for a password and i didnt set one
Samba share huh?
yes
any idea??
One way is to just set: security = share :in the global sextion of /etc/samba/smb.conf
Don't forget to restart samba afterwards /etc/init.d/samba restart
umm in the conf file i went ; security = share.. it still came up afterwards..
www.pastebin.com and paste in the section for the share you're offering
And then paste the url here
is that wat u meant :S
the section for the share you're offering
meaning.....
the folder?
Just to clarify, it asks for the password when you try to get a list of the shares availible, or when you try to enter a share?
um well heres what i do.. i type into my windows computer "\\ubuntu\music" (my shared folder) it then pops up and asks for a username and password
Do you mind if your samba security (as in passwords) is more or less ignored?
i would rather it be ignored?
i dont really want passwords at all
http://www.pastebin.com/263686
http://www.pastebin.com/263688
should i add the [storage]  to mine? and edit it to my desires?
Well, storage is just the name of the share
ok in the first pastebin url u had them all in that order.. is that 'exactly' what i need because i have all that stuff edited but.. they have jibble jabbles in between
I don't think it matters all that much, I pulled them in from all over the place
ill restart it and give it a go
it's still asking for a username & password
Paste your full smb.conf to pastebin
no prob
You forgot to remove the ; in front of security = share
oh i didnt know i had to do that 8-) lol
ok i'll give that a go
Probably remove the ; in front of guest account = nobody too
ok
u rock dude :)
Of course *g*
lol

you wouldnt be able to post me your Mouse Configuration from the Default xorg.conf file would ya.. its just that i tried to configure mine so that my back and forward buttons were working.. it turned out that all of them work but they are all switched around and well i use my scroller a lot more.. lol
What mouse do you have?
Intellimouse Explorer 3.0
you wouldnt know how to um fix it would ya?
Doh, that's not the default mouse section, but it's mine and it works:P
i've been to like a million sites to fix it to no avail lol
no prob lol it might get my scroller working properly again.
Remember you have to reload X after chaning the config file
its just when i tried fixing it and putting other things in my scroller buttons switched with my back and forward buttons
so they were acting as each other.. and well i use my scroller more so than my back and forward buttons
Paste your mouse section somewhere and I'll see what I can think up
lol i just deleted it all just wait i'll find the site where i got it from
Heh, if you use the section I pasted it might work
ok lol
It'll be the ZAxisMapping bit, now personally I havn't dealt with the mouse bit myself, but if you change it to "4 5" it might work like an ordinary mouse *shrug* :)
umm yeah but it doesnt lol it then just cancels out my back and forward buttons and my scroller still acts as my back and forward buttons
Add them into gnome session
oh yeah thanks :)
are u there ?
damn
lol, umm that startup process command doesnt seem to work..
I just typed in what i would normally type into terminal.. is that right?
Erm how did you add it excatly?:)
pressed add..
in Startup Programs..?
Yeah, should be fine
well it dosent work
*shrug* everything I've added to 'startup programs' in the gnome session prefs loads when I login to gnome:)
into startup programs i typed this command "imwheel -k -b "67"" and that didnt open
Do it without the " ?
yes i did it without the "
maybe i have to set a timer on it?
Try editing the order to something like 45
o to 45 why 45?
Ya
Dance a jig!
i have created a file ~/.Xsession it has my startup commands in it .. how do i execute it when i startup?
No idea, never dealt with it
gftp

Er, try loading up gnome-system-manager
